general/what-types-of-applications.html.title: What types of applications can I build with Bandwidth Voice and Messaging APIs?
general/what-types-of-applications.html.body: Our cloud APIs support many types of applications, from text messaging apps, voicemail, appointment reminders, conference calling, call analytics & lead generation tracking, virtual phone systems, private phone number services, IVRs and call centers.

general/direct-to-carrier.html.title: What exactly does direct-to-carrier mean?
general/direct-to-carrier.html.body:
Bandwidth is the only carrier who owns BOTH our own network for voice and messaging and a cloud API platform for applications.
Direct-to-carrier means you can purchase phone numbers and network usage directly from a carrier, while still using cloud APIs to power you app.

general/contact-sales.html.title: How do I get in touch with someone on the Bandwidth sales team?
general/contact-sales.html.body: You can call us at (855) 290-8135 or email sales here.

general/new-features.html.title: I don’t see a feature I am looking for, where can I ask about it?
general/new-features.html.body: We try to publish new features as “beta” as soon as we can on our documentation site, but if you are looking for a feature not documented, contact our sales team and they can route your request to the product team who would be able to answer your question.

phone-numbers/voice-messaging.html.title: Are Bandwidth local phone numbers voice and messaging enabled?
phone-numbers/voice-messaging.html.body: Yes, all Bandwidth local phone numbers are both voice and messaging enabled.

phone-numbers/tollfree.html.title: Can I get a toll-free phone numbers from Bandwidth?
phone-numbers/tollfree.html.body: Yes, Bandwidth has a large inventory of toll free phone numbers.

phone-numbers/how-long-activate.html.title: How long does it take to activate a phone number before it can receive phone calls or text messages?
phone-numbers/how-long-activate.html.body: From instantly to a few seconds. Bandwidth available phone number inventory is already activated on our network for voice and messaging, when you activate a phone number for use on your account, it is ready for use immediately.

phone-numbers/remove-number.html.title: How can I deactivate and remove a number from my account?
phone-numbers/remove-number.html.body: You can remove numbers from your account by using a DELETE to the /phoneNumbers/> endpoint to remove it or by using the developer console My Numbers tab.

phone-numbers/recover-number.html.title: Can I get back a phone number I released accidentally?
phone-numbers/recover-number.html.body: Probably, phone numbers that are released do not become available for customers other customers to use and it is possible to restore that number, but you will need to contact our support team with your account information and the number that you need restored.

import-numbers/how-to-i-import-external-.title: How to I import external phone numbers to use with messaging hub?
import-numbers/how-to-i-import-external-.body:
Take a look at the getting started guide on the developer page.
You will need to contact sales@bandwidth.com if you need to enable your account.

import-numbers/how-do-i-import-numbers-f.title: How do I import numbers from the dashboard to use for voice or messaging?
import-numbers/how-do-i-import-numbers-f.body: To import numbers from the Bandwidth Dashboard to use with our Voice and Messaging APIs, please follow the guide on the developer site.

messaging/mediaType.html.title: What media type is supported for MMS?

We support up to 1.5 MB for external media and 2 MB for internal media.

messaging/smsTwoWay.html.title: Can I use Bandwidth phone numbers for SMS?
messaging/smsTwoWay.html.body: Yes, all Bandwidth phone numbers are enabled for both voice and two-way SMS.

messaging/tollFreeSMS.html.title: Can I send an SMS with a toll-free Bandwidth number?
messaging/tollFreeSMS.html.body:
Yes, you can, but you will need to first order a toll-free number. Toll-free numbers are automatically enabled with SMS.
Toll-free numbers can not send MMS (picture/video messages)

messaging/smsRateLimits.html.title: How many outbound SMS can I send at a time from a single phone number?
messaging/smsRateLimits.html.body:
Local phone numbers are intended for two-way communication. 
Industry guidelines normally permit users to send at 1 msg / sec per phone number.
Learn more about our rate limits.

messaging/maxCharacters.html.title: What is the max characters I can send in an SMS?
messaging/maxCharacters.html.body: A normal SMS is 160 characters, but we support concatenated messages to carriers and devices who support it.  Our SMS API will accept up to 2048 characters.  In the case the carrier or handset doesn’t support, it will be delivered as message 1/2, 2/2, etc.

messaging/dlrSMS.html.title: Can I get a delivery receipt for SMS that I send?
messaging/dlrSMS.html.body: Yes, delivery receipts are supported. Please review our API docs for '/messages'.

messaging/internationalSMS.html.title: Can I send and receive SMS to international phone numbers?
messaging/internationalSMS.html.body: Bandwidth offers local and toll-free phone numbers for the US and Canada only, but can deliver messages worldwide. If you would like details about our international SMS services, please contact us at 855-290-8135 or send us an email.

messaging/emojiSMS.html.title: Can I send and receive Emoji in SMS messages?
messaging/emojiSMS.html.body: Yes. You are able to send and receive emoji in SMS, keep in mind not all wireless devices or internet VoIP services support emoji but for most North American services, sending and receiving emoji with a Bandwidth virtual phone number will work.

messaging/bodyEncoding.html.title: What Character sets can I use in SMS body?
messaging/bodyEncoding.html.body: International characters: Currently we support ASCII + UCS2 characters as well as UTF8.

messaging/customCallerId.html.title: Can I set the Caller Id on an outgoing message to anything I want?
messaging/customCallerId.html.body: No. You can only send outgoing messages from phone numbers you have activated on your account.

messaging/shortCodes.html.title: Can my Bandwidth phone number send SMS to a US and Canada Short Codes?
messaging/shortCodes.html.body:
Yes. We support most US and Canadian short codes. We do not support sending to premium short codes.
If you'd like to know if we support a specific short code, please contact Bandwidth support. For a complete list of short codes, you can visit the U.S. Short Codes Directory.

messaging/sellShortCodes.html.title: Does Bandwidth sell or host Short Codes?
messaging/sellShortCodes.html.body: No, not at this time. Bandwidth provides virtual local and toll-free phone numbers for apps needing two-way SMS/MMS. Toll-Free numbers do not come sms enabled, so please open a ticket with us to enable them.

messaging/premiumSMS.html.title: Can Bandwidth phone numbers send and receive Premium SMS to do things like make donations using SMS?
messaging/premiumSMS.html.body: No. Bandwidth phone numbers do not support Premium SMS at this time. If you send a SMS to a Premium SMS Short Code like the Red Cross ( 90999), you will receive a message back that says: “This campaign is not currently available through your service provider”. Your account will be charged for the normal incoming and outgoing SMS.

messaging/retainSMS.html.title: How long does Bandwidth retain messages?
messaging/retainSMS.html.body:
Bandwidth keeps messages sent with the v1 api for 30 days. After 30 days, you will no longer be able to fetch that particular message.
For information on how to list messages, see the list messages and for how to get more information on a specific message see the message info resource.

messaging/retainMMS.html.title: How long does Bandwidth retain incoming message media (MMS)?
messaging/retainMMS.html.body:
Bandwidth keeps message media for 30 days at minimum. Be sure to fetch and save any media you want to keep before the 30 days are up.
For information on how to list media files, see the list media and for how to download a specific media file, see the download media resource.

messaging/dlrMMS.html.title: Are delivery receipts supported for MMS?
messaging/dlrMMS.html.body: No, delivery receipts are currently not supported for MMS.

messaging/tollfreeMMS.html.title: Can toll-free numbers send MMS messages or messages to Short Codes?
messaging/tollfreeMMS.html.body: No, Toll Free numbers can only send SMS messages.

messaging/longSMS.html.title: If I send a long SMS (160+ characters), will the message be parted out and will I be charged for each part of the message?
messaging/longSMS.html.body: If you send a message that contains more than 160 characters, your message will be split up into multiple parts. You will only be charged for one message and the message will be re-assembled before it reaches the destination handset.

messaging/receiveInternationalMMS.html.title: Can I receive MMS (picture messages) from international numbers to a Bandwidth Number
messaging/receiveInternationalMMS.html.body: No, you can not receive a MMS from an international number. An international number is any number that does not begin with +1.

voice/configureIncoming.html.title: How can I configure my application to get incoming phone calls?
voice/configureIncoming.html.body: To configure your application to receive incoming phone calls, please follow our how to guide

voice/recordCall.html.title: Can I record a phone call?
voice/recordCall.html.body: Yes, you are able to record phone calls by setting the record property to true for a /calls resource either on call creation or anytime while the call is live. MP3 and WAV formats are both supported.

voice/conference.html.title: Does Bandwidth support conference calling?
voice/conference.html.body: Yes, see our API reference /conferences for how to create a conference call.

voice/confBridge.html.title: What is the difference between bridges and conferences?
voice/confBridge.html.body: A bridge is between two calls. A conference is between 3 or more calls.

voice/transcription.html.title: Does Bandwidth support transcription?
voice/transcription.html.body: Yes, calls recorded in .wav format can be transcribed. Please see our /transcriptions resource for more details.

voice/stopIncoming.html.title: How can I stop receiving calls for a phone number?
voice/stopIncoming.html.body:
If you do not want to receive any phone calls for a list of phone numbers assigned to an application, you must remove the incomingCallUrl property and set the autoAnswer property to ‘false’ for your application associated with that phone number.
You can also remove the phone number from an application

voice/international.html.title: Can I receive calls on my Bandwidth phone numbers from international callers?
voice/international.html.body:
Yes, Bandwidth phone numbers can receive inbound calls from most international callers.
However, there is a list of areas codes that are not supported for voice service on our network. Please read the full list.

voice/forwards.html.title: In the event that a call gets forwarded before it reaches my number, will I be able to see all numbers involved on the call?
voice/forwards.html.body: In the event that a call gets forwarded before it reaches our platform, we will only be able to pass either the original calling number or the number that performed the forward.

voice/xheaders.html.title: What is the maximum amount of characters I can use in an X-header?
voice/xheaders.html.body: The maximum amount of characters allowed for X-Headers is 256 per header. You can use up to 5 headers per call.

voice/callRecordings.html.title: How long does Bandwidth retain phone call recordings?
voice/callRecordings.html.body:
Bandwidth keeps recordings for 30 days. Be sure to fetch and save any recordings you want to keep before the 30 days are up.
To list recordings, use this API: http://dev.bandwidth.com/ap-docs/methods/recordings/getRecordings.html
To retrieve recordings, use this API: http://dev.bandwidth.com/ap-docs/methods/media/getMediaMediaName.html
To delete a recording (or any media file), use this API: http://dev.bandwidth.com/ap-docs/methods/media/deleteMediaMediaName.html

applications/timeouts.html.title: How are incoming callback timeouts measured?
applications/timeouts.html.body: When creating applications on your account, it is important to keep in mind that incoming callback timeout values are measured in milliseconds. This applies to both voice and messaging callbacks.

applications/retries.html.title: How many times will Bandwidth send my application a request before it fails?
applications/retries.html.body: Bandwidth will try your Callback URL and Fallback URL once before traffic will fail. You can configure a timeout value for both URLs up to 10000 ms.
